div.a: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1877 South Italy, c. 1950 Burial: c. 500 B.C. (K) Contents: c. 200 incuse AR Metapontum: 28+ st. (to Noe 235) 1+ dr. (as Noe 31 ?) 1+ diob. (as Noe 264) Sybaris: 10+ st. Caulonia: 2+ st. (Noe Grp. A) 1+ dr. (obv. and rev. ΚVΑΛΟ Croton: 6+ st. (1 with rev. eagle) Disposition: dispersed Information about what in each case appears to be the same hd. is derived from several sources: a list of 49 varieties (as above) in the ANS; a report in the ANS of coins seen on the market in 1950; a group of coins belonging to Col. G. dc Laval, "acquired from an Italian traveller around 1950," and photographed at Stockholm in the early fifties; uniform color suggested that they were from a hd. These coins reappeared in Glendining s. Apr. 18, 1955 (Laval), lots 99-104 (Metapontum), 116-8 and the third- stater of 119 (Sybaris), 133 (Caulonia) and 135 (Croton); 117 is now at Oxford (SNG 844) These three sources all appear to relate to a single large hd. containing only the earlier incuse issues
